attributes.action: Stop the uncertainty and sign article 50 as soon as possible.
attributes.additional_details: On a LBC radio interview with Nick Ferrari on June 22nd 2016 David Cameron said that he would carry out the wishes of the people after the referendum. This must include signing article 50 and starting the brexit process. He has to do this as soon as possible, to bring stability and direction to the nation. Although Mr Cameron has resigned he has not stepped down yet, we need him to fulfil his duties as the representative of the people, before handing over power to the new leader.
attributes.background: David Cameron said in the event of a vote for brexit "he would carry out the wishes of the people." This must start with Mr Cameron signing article 50 for the nation. We cannot wait for the next PM to take the responsibility. At this time the British people need leadership and direction.
